about.title: Hi ‚Äî I'm Zhanat Kairbekov
aboutText: I'm a junior frontend developer and a graduate of OmAEiP with a degree in ‚ÄúInformation Systems and Programming‚Äù. I work with a modern frontend stack and keep expanding into backend.
I'm currently studying at Alem School (Astana Hub), building pet projects and improving my stack: JavaScript, TypeScript, React. In parallel, I'm learning Go for backend development.

Recently I built a website for the Downtown Astana business center and have experience creating responsive interfaces with a focus on performance and SEO. Open to collaboration and freelance projects.
skillsText: Frontend: HTML5, CSS3 (vanilla, SCSS), responsive and cross‚Äëbrowser layout, JavaScript (ES6+), TypeScript, React (hooks, routing), Vite, Webpack, Git.
Tools & ecosystem: Figma, npm, REST API, forms & validation, load optimization, basic CI/CD skills.
Backend / other: Go, PHP (Laravel), basic knowledge of Node.js and SQL ‚Äî for end‚Äëto‚Äëend app development.
Also: SEO, performance, accessibility (a11y), analytics and error monitoring.
projectsText: Kairbekov Official: personal website with custom UI effects, responsive layout and SEO optimization.
Downtown Astana: business center website ‚Äî responsive design, image optimization and performance improvements.
Saukele: Laravel diploma project ‚Äî full cycle: design, backend implementation, database integration.
Velobike (clone): responsive clone of velobike.kz ‚Äî careful work with grids and mobile layout.

items.title: Landing Page development
items.description: I'll create a unique, responsive and modern website with an individual design focused on increasing sales and attracting customers.

myModal1.p1: A modern Single Page Application (SPA), rebuilt from a classic stack to a powerful combo of <1>React 18</1> and <3>Vite</3>.
features: Component architecture for easier maintenance.
Using <1>React Hooks</1> (useState, useEffect) for state and animations.
Optimized Vite build for fast loading.
Interactive <1>Custom Cursor</1> and advanced CSS effects.
Fully responsive and deployed via <1>Netlify</1>.

myModal2.h2: üè¢ downtownastana.com ‚Äî Business center website on Laravel (Docker + Make)
myModal2.p1: A full-featured business center website with an admin panel for managing content, tenants, service orders and more. Built with <1>Laravel</1>, focusing on scalability, security and convenient administration.
features: <1>Infrastructure:</1> Containerization with <3>Docker</3> and <5>Docker Compose</5> for easy deployment and scaling (PHP, Nginx, MySQL/PostgreSQL, Redis).
<1>Automation:</1> <3>Makefile</3> for common tasks: build, migrations, seeding, deploy (SSH or CI/CD with GitHub Actions).
<1>Admin panel:</1> <3>Filament PHP</3> with custom CRUD, analytics and role support.
<1>Storage & media:</1> <3>Storage Link</3>, S3-compatible storage, image optimization, document uploads.
<1>Backend:</1> Eloquent models/migrations, Artisan commands, queues, notifications, payments, PDF generation.
<1>Extra:</1> APIs for mobile, Redis caching, Telescope, security (CSRF, rate limiting), SEO meta tags.
myModal2.note: This project showcases full‚Äëstack skills: from database and backend logic to frontend and deployment ‚Äî focused on real business needs in Astana.

myModal3.p1: A professional <1>E-commerce</1> solution built for the Omsk regional public organization <3>‚ÄúKazakhs of Omsk‚Äù</3> ‚Äî a full platform for selling products with national identity.
features: Built with the powerful PHP framework <1>Laravel</1>.
Using <1>Blade</1> templates for fast, dynamic UI.
Secure cart and order management.
A unique custom design aligned with the organization‚Äôs branding.
myModal3.legalText: This project is intellectual property. Copyright for the code and design belongs to the developer <1> Zhanat Kairbekov</1>. Client: ‚ÄúKazakhs of Omsk‚Äù.

myModal4.p1: A detailed replica of a popular bike rental service, made as a learning project. Main focus: <1>pixel‚Äëperfect</1> layout and clean UX.
features: <1>Multilingual:</1> Full Russian and Kazakh support via separate structures.
<1>Custom JS:</1> Custom slider, responsive burger menu and interactive dropdowns.
<1>Layout:</1> Complex responsive grid working across all devices (Mobile First).
<1>Performance:</1> Fully static project with optimized assets for fast loading.
myModal4.disclaimerText: Created for educational purposes only. All content and brand rights belong to the original Velobike.kz service.

myModal5.p1: An interactive app visualizing <1>BFS (Breadth‚ÄëFirst Search)</1>. It finds the shortest path in a maze and shows the algorithm step by step.
features: <1>Algorithm:</1> BFS guarantees the shortest path in an unweighted graph.
<1>Data structure:</1> Queues and parent nodes for efficient path reconstruction.
<1>Visualization:</1> Step-by-step matrix states: <3>0</3> free, <5>1</5> wall, <7>2</7> visited, <9>3</9> final path.
<1>Scalability:</1> Supports maps from simple 5x5 to complex 30x30 mazes.
myModal5.csText: This project demonstrates graph skills, understanding of time complexity <1>O(V + E)</1>, and translating math abstractions into UI.

myModal6.p1: A dynamic web app showing advanced work with <1>React</1> and animation libraries. It integrates with an external API to fetch up-to-date product data.
features: <1>Framer Motion:</1> Orchestrated animations (staggered list, smooth filtering transitions, hover micro-interactions).
<1>API integration:</1> Async work with <3>FakeStoreAPI</3> via Fetch API, with loading and error states.
<1>SCSS & BEM:</1> Modular styling architecture for maintainability.
<1>Responsive design:</1> Adaptive grid for all screen sizes.
myModal6.uxText: Special attention to micro‚Äëinteractions and interface states (empty states, loading skeleton) for a premium feel.
